Posts.Content: rita22 wrote: Anybody  have a BI-RADS 5 report and have the biopysy come back normal?  I have a Lobulated Mass 2.5CM in the 12:00 position I have a biopsy scheduled for Tuesday but the waiting is Making me nervous! Dx 9/10/2014, IDC, 3cm, Stage IIA, Grade 3, 0/2 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2+ Surgery 9/29/2014 Lumpectomy: Right; Lymph node removal: Right, Sentinel Chemotherapy 11/3/2014 Adriamycin (doxorubicin), Carboplatin (Paraplatin), Taxol (paclitaxel) Targeted Therapy 3/5/2015 Herceptin (trastuzumab) Radiation Therapy 5/24/2015 Breast Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: BI-RADS 5 rita22 Miah-xx

Posts.Content: Sep 14, 2014 07:12AM rita22 wrote: looks like we are in similar situations kcarcarey.  The Radiologist told me the same thing.  My surgeon didn't want to give her opinion until the biopsy results came back but did tell me she was worried.that it would be cancer.  When I went into my biopsy they told me that they would be shocked if it came back benign.  I feel much better now that I know what it is.  I have Invasive Ductal Carcinoma Stage IIA.  I was just diagnosed a few days ago and will be taking a trip to see the surgeon and have more test on Tuesday.  I feel blessed that it is a treatable cancer and the out look is very good.  Its definitely not something fun to go through but there are worse cancers to get than breast cancer and I know I can beat it. I have heard of women having a birads 5 score and it not being cancer but the odds are not that great.  My mass is a similar size to yours at 2.5cm  do you mind me asking if your mass is tender to the touch?  Everyone tells me that breast cancer doesn't hurt.  I wouldn't call it painful, but it is definitely sore and tender.
Posts.Title: BI-RADS 5 rita22 Miah-xx

Posts.Content: Sep 7, 2014 05:49PM rita22 wrote: Thanks!  I am also hoping for the best but expecting to find something.  I wish I could speed things along.  I just want to know what I am up against.  its nice to hear that others with bi-rads5 have bean benign.
